body: If the configuration is correct,The Installation path of Skywalking  cannot contain spaces, for example D:\Program Files\apache-skywalking-apm-bin will fail,D:\apache-skywalking-apm-bin will succeed.

> Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.
> 
> * Why do you submit this issue?
> * storage 配置mysql后，collector启动不起来

English only. And the thing you asking is violating the Apache rules. We do not belong a vendor, this is a community.
That is complex. You should read codes. If you run an open source project compatible with skywalking, I could help.
@qxo Are you still working on this?
That config is not the thing you thought. It is just for es bulk flush, not for just saving.

@zi-co from your screenshot, it seems that you've set the `SW_STORAGE_ES_FLUSH_INTERVAL` to `3`? Note that there're three parameters/options that effect the bulk flush, namely `SW_STORAGE_ES_BULK_ACTIONS`, `SW_STORAGE_ES_BULK_SIZE`, `SW_STORAGE_ES_FLUSH_INTERVAL`

@kezhenxu94 this is my config
bulkActions: ${SW_STORAGE_ES_BULK_ACTIONS:2000} # Execute the bulk every 2000 requests
    bulkSize: ${SW_STORAGE_ES_BULK_SIZE:200} # flush the bulk every 20mb
    flushInterval: ${SW_STORAGE_ES_FLUSH_INTERVAL:100} # flush the bulk every 10 seconds whatever the number of requests
![config](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/52992632/61371661-dced2c80-a8c7-11e9-94ab-7d7cb111ddcf.png)
This is open source😃 Simply read the codes, then we have the answer.
ok,thanks.
Send pull request if need fix. That is how the project grows, and how open source always is better than traditional projects.

FYI @wu-sheng , I'm recently considering whether we should create a new module/directory to place all the benchmark tests like other projects, the reasons are:

1. we have some benchmarks that are independent to any existed module, such as `LinkedArrayBenchmark`, `StringFormatBenchmarkTest`, IMHO they should be placed in an independent module, otherwise it's hard for new-comers to refer to and find out whether we already have that benchmark or not

2. some of the existed benchmarks are annotated with `@Test`, and are executed in maven test phase (I think), which is not necessary and time consuming, gathering them together may be easy to manage and remove `@Test`

Just a bold thought and may make no sense at all :)
@kezhenxu94 How about we create WIKI pages for that? And link to the PRs?

We have this. https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/SKYWALKING/Home 

I could grant committers access right. Then all the acceptable performance improvement PRs, should have a benchmark list there.

> @kezhenxu94 How about we create WIKI pages for that? And link to the PRs?

That's a great alternative, it would be easy for new-comers who are interested in performance optimization and can refer to the wiki

I mean just add a `if`,such as 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11530760/61388341-5269f480-a8ea-11e9-8e53-0179b28b4be2.png)
cause for servlet below version 3 just not have `getStatus` method which we used ,this method will effect `springMvc`,`tomcat`,`jetty`.

So in servlet2.5,we just ignore the status judge  .

Out of this patch.
ArrayList has worse performance because ArrayList uses `add()` one by one. It would be better if using `addAll()` or `new ArrayList<>(collections)`.
We accept a lot of performance improvements these days, but we don't need to focus on that too much.

Like I said in some other PRs, we don't require people to change their coding style, due to that is personal interests.

It is only acceptable when causing runtime performance issue.
Yes. In this case, it is more importance to fix `size`. And I say that it is out of this issue. Just for talking.

OK, that is a tricky thing to JVM, using a fast fail to acoid the issue. I guess it should work.

Please test it, if pass as expected, submit the PR.

For blocking, I don't know. But in master branch, we set timeout in 10 seconds. Block should be ignored by that. But you need to be careful why your target is blocked, meaning no-response. Is your another OAP node dead? Or Really blocking because of storage(ES) performance?

> For blocking, I don't know. But in master branch, we set timeout in 10 seconds. Block should be ignored by that. But you need to be careful why your target is blocked, meaning no-response. Is your another OAP node dead? Or Really blocking because of storage(ES) performance?

All right. What is the role of the heartbeat in skywalking?

Why do we need to change this? How much performance does it bring to the agents?

I am not just asking benchmark, I am asking about in the real scenario tests

1. The change TraceAnnotationMethodInterceptor  in this pr is the use case 
2. After change of TraceAnnotationMethodInterceptor  the code more strong (fail-fast)
and it could improve the performance  if we grid of the invoke  for ThreadLocal 
It's another pr I want to do:)
Are you using vscode to develop SkyWalking?

> Are you using vscode to develop SkyWalking?

Yes, sometimes  with vscode and sometimes with eclipse

I do know it is related to performance. My question is how much. 

Change API will break many things, including document etc. especially we have many plugins today. I have found any real performance issue by using ThreadLocal. Actually, most of plugins wouldn't use this.

> I do know it is related to performance. My question is how much.
> 
> Change API will break many things, including document etc. especially we have many plugins today. I have found any real performance issue by using ThreadLocal. Actually, most of plugins wouldn't use this.

The change of API is for the future, and it's compatible with the exist plugin (  without change the plugin ).

All these changes, including #3124 , need to be proved necessary. Also need to have multiple PMC/committors support that. I would not make the call here.

You should know, as OSS project, we only add or change API when it is necessary, especially these are all open APIs. You are bringing the extra maintain payload to the community.

Personally, I would support this change.

-1 from me.

cc @apache/skywalking-committers if anyone who wants this, please `+1 explicitly. And explain why and what are the scenarios.

> All right. What is the role of the heartbeat in skywalking?

Keep services shown in the UI.
Change APIs must pass discussions and get supports from PMC.
Ask committer and PMC, id they support, open issue to discuss. We could not change core API directly.

I agree the API should not change if necessary
On my point of view, the API should  change  for the future 

This PR try to  make the API strong: pass span over MethodAroundContext 
 and then call `ContextManager#stopSpan(span)`   -- the fail-fast version of stopSpan

combine with #3124( "span carrry TracingContext" , reduce call ThreadLocal  if not required ) will improve  the performance  additionally

FYI @hanahmily this warning should be noticed.
I think most of all committers/contributors are using IntelliJ today.

Yes, I agree the two PRs will improve the performance, but we need to be careful about that. SkyWalking today is making the project more stable by several version releases. So, if we noticed serious performance concerns, we prefer to keep unchanged. Also, we haven't received the report, our agent core(not perfect :) for sure) causes the performance issue to target applications.

The result of successful builds looks promising

- CI-with-IT: takes ~19 minutes to ~26 minutes before and ~10 minutes after (with parallel runs)

- E2E: takes ~14 minutes to ~16 minutes before and ~12 minutes after (mainly benefits from the compile time, ~6m down to ~3m)
/run e2e

Based on the above information, cannot reproduce the error,from the error log ,the  threadlocal `get()->CONTEXT` may be null in that moment,I think maybe some previous `ContextManager.stop` in other plugin may have make the `activeSpanStack` empty.

you can use multiple addresses with comma(`,`) separated in the config `SW_STORAGE_ES_CLUSTER_NODES`, such as `host1:9200,host2:9200`
